member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Returns all of the holidays occuring in the year following the date that is passed in the constructor. Holidays are defined in an XML file.
member.param: The starting date for returning holidays. All holidays for one year after this date are returned.
The path to the XML file that contains the holiday definitions.

member.name: P:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.OrderedHolidays
member.summary: The holidays occuring after StartDate listed in chronological order;

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.ProcessXML
member.summary: Loops through the holidays defined in the XML configuration file, and adds the next occurance into the OrderHolidays collection if it occurs within one year.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.ProcessNode(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Processes a Holiday node from the XML configuration file.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.Easter
member.summary: Determines the next occurance of Easter (western Christian).

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.Easter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines the occurance of Easter in the given year. If the result comes before StartDate, recalculates for the following year.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.GetDateByWeekdayOnOrAfter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the next occurance of a weekday after a given month and day in the year after StartDate.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.GetDateByMonthWeekWeekday(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the n'th instance of a day-of-week in the given month after StartDate
member.param: The month the Holiday falls on.
The instance of weekday that the Holiday falls on (5=last instance in the month).
The day of the week that the Holiday falls on.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.HolidayCalculator.GetFirstDayOfMonth(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the first day of the month for the specified date.

member.summary: Gets the target path of the shortcut.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.SplitUppercaseToString(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a camel cased or pascal cased string and returns a new string with spaces between the words in the string.
member.example: The string "PascalCasing" will return an array with two elements, "Pascal" and "Casing".

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.SplitUppercase(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a camel cased or pascal cased string and returns an array of the words within the string.
member.example: The string "PascalCasing" will return an array with two elements, "Pascal" and "Casing".

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.ManagementInfoToListView(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.ListView@,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds formatted Management information to a listview given the class name.
member.param: If true empty values are not displayed.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.ManagementInfoToListView(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.ListView@,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripProgressBar@)
member.summary: Adds formatted Management information to a listview given the class name. This overload adds support for a tool strip progress bar.
member.param: If true empty values are not displayed.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels a WMI information gathering method at the end of the next iteration.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.AddGroupForNoResults(System.Windows.Forms.ListView@)
member.summary: Adds a group and item to a listview when a Win32 class search returns no results. The text of the group will be "Returned" and the text of the item will be "No Results Returned."

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.AddGroupForNoResults(System.Windows.Forms.ListView@,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a group and item to a listview when a Win32 class search returns no results. The text of the group will be groupName and the text of the item will be message.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.ResizeListViewColumns(System.Windows.Forms.ListView@,System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeaderAutoResizeStyle)
member.summary: Auto resizes ListView columns. This overload provides the option to hide one column by setting its width to 0.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ManagementInfo.ResizeListViewColumns(System.Windows.Forms.ListView@,System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeaderAutoResizeStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Auto resizes ListView columns. This overload provides the option to hide one column by setting its width to 0.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.UserInformation.ResizePanel(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Resize panel to fit containing control.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.GetFrameworkVersion
member.summary: Queries the Registry and returns the highest .NET Framework version found or 0 if none is found.
member.returns: A double indicating the major and minor version of the .NET Framework.
member.remarks: This code is confirmed for versions 1.1, 2.0, 3.0 and 3.5. Later versions are simply educated guesses. Hopefully beginning with version 3.5, Microsoft will assign the versioning task away from the marketing department and this mess will not be necessary.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.GetOSProductKey
member.summary: Read the value of: HKLM\SOFTWARE\MICROSOFT\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\DigitalProductId and decode the Windows CD Key.
member.returns: Returns the Windows CD Key if successful. Returns "Unknown" upon failure.

members.member:
Description:this function will accept any date as the only parameter and will return you the week number the supplied date lies into. > Date for which the week number is desired.
Return the week number as an integer.

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.AppShortVersion
member.summary: Application Major and Minor Version Separated by a Decimal

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.ClrShortVersion
member.summary: CLR Major and Minor Version Separated by a Decimal

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetFrameworkVersion
member.summary: .NET Framework Major and Minor Version Separated by a Decimal

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetMacAddress
member.summary: Network Interface Media Access Control (MAC) Address

member.summary: Network Interface Internet Protocol (IP) Enabled Status

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetDhcpEnabled
member.summary: Network Interface Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Enabled Status

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetDhcpLeaseObtained
member.summary: Date Network Interface Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Lease Obtained

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetDhcpLeaseExpires
member.summary: Network Interface Date Network Interface Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Lease Expires

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetDhcpServer
member.summary: Network Interface Date Network Interface Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Server

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetTcpNumberConnections
member.summary: Number of Network Interface Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Connections

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetTcpWindowSize
member.summary: Network Interface Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Window Size

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.NetIPAddress
member.remarks: Modified to show all IP addresses including IPv6.

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.OSType
member.summary: Type of build, ie. checked/free and single/multi processor

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.OSShortVersion
member.summary: Operating System Major and Minor Version Separated by a Decimal

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.OSStartTime
member.summary: Date/Time of Last System Start as Date

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.OperatingSystemIs64Bit
member.summary: Returns True if Operating System 64-Bit Version Installed.

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.UserAccounts
member.summary: Collection of User Accounts on This Computer

member.name: P:SystemInformation.ComputerInformation.VisualStyleIsSupportedByOS
member.summary: Visual Style Supported by Operating System

member.name: F:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.singeltonSplashScreen
member.summary: Contains a singelton Shared splashscreen (runs in its own thread).

member.name: F:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.splashScreenCreatedEvent
member.summary: Indicates that the splasscreen is created.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.StartSplashScreen
member.summary: Starts a new thread that runs the splasscreen.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.StartSplashScreenMethod(System.Object)
member.summary: Is the actual splashscreen method on a separate thread.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.SetSplashScreenState(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the state of the splasscreen.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.SetSplashScreenStateMethod(System.String)
member.summary: The private method called by SetSplasScreenState that actually changes the state.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.OnLoad(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the OnLoad of the splashscreen. When this is called the window and its handle exists.

member.name: T:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.ChangeSplashScreenDelegate
member.summary: Defines the delegate used to communicate with the splasscreen via BeginInvoke.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.GetFrameworkShortVersion
member.returns: Returns a string with the version number, if there is an error an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.GetFrameworkServicePack
member.summary: A special section of the registry has to be querried to find out the service pack of the .NET Framework. A different location was used for 1.0 and 1.1, but since this application only runs on version 2.0, we won't worry about that.
member.returns: A string containing the version number, for example: "2.0"

member.name: M:SystemInformation.SplashScreen.ReturnHighestFrameworkVersion
member.summary: Queries the Registry and returns the highest .NET Framework version found or 0 if none is found.
member.returns: A double indicating the major and minor version of the .NET Framework.
member.remarks: This code is confirmed for versions 1.1, 2.0, 3.0 and 3.5. Later versions are simply educated guesses. Hopefully beginning with version 3.5, Microsoft will assign the versioning task away from the marketing department and this mess will not be necessary.

member.name: M:SystemInformation.Network.FormatIPv6Address(System.String)
member.summary: Formats an IPv6 address by converting to upper case, if necessary. Also removes "%" and extraneous number from Net.Dns.GetHostEntry.AddressList.
